title: Minimum Add to Make Parentheses Valid
content:
Given a string  of  and  parentheses, we add the minimum number of parentheses (  or , and in any positions ) so that the resulting parentheses string is valid.
Formally, a parentheses string is valid if and only if:

It is the empty string, or
It can be written as  ( concatenated with ), where  and  are valid strings, or
It can be written as , where  is a valid string.

Given a parentheses string, return the minimum number of parentheses we must add to make the resulting string valid.
